resources.string:
Go-No Go is a task that tests the inhibitory control of the user. In each trial the user will be subjected to stimuli that indicates a Go or a No Go in order to gauge their motor activity.

Users will be shown a green area indicating a Go, where the user should tap the area, then in another instance they may be shown a red area indicating a No-Go, where the user should not tap the area.

There are two different Go-No Go modes, being standard and endless. In standard mode the user will be prompted for a set amount of Gos and No Gos and in the endless mode the user will be prompted until they make a mistake. At the end of each trial users will be able to see their data for a given session or their lifetime statistics.
